page.title: 10News item 1985.
page.content: On 24th, 25th and 26th of March 1985 Ferryside was in the news. Three men had been left stranded on the sandbanks out in the estuary and rescue services had to be called out for assistance. A girl aged 10 was a witness to what happened. On Sunday March 24th Rebecca Pearson and I were playing on the beach when suddenly my older sister rushed on to the beach and shouted "Hey dad's been called out on duty."I wondered what was going on.I looked up and there was a yellow helicopter hovering around.Then I saw my dad going past in the rescue boat.There were four people who had been on a walk to {Scott's Bay}in Llanstephan and they had got trapped by the tide. (continued on page 11.)
